result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith J Eggum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 03-30-2017: SENTENCE FROM 05-10-2016 IS VACATED
Consecutive to: current sentence & count 1

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Under go any assessments and follow through with recommendations as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Statutory costs assessed. Costs are to be paid during the term of ES. It is NOT the Courts intention to have costs deducted from inmate accounts.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically anger management and cognitive intervention. No taverns, bars or liquor stores.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith J Eggum in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Keith J Eggum in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defendant indicates to Ms. Johnson he does not wish to be part of the proceedings. The defendant is brought into court - the Court speaks with the deft. Defendant became extremely disruptive and was removed from the courtroom. The defendant was removed to a room in RCJ. Ms. Johnson will remain in the courtroom and the defendant will appear by video. Mr. Eggum appears via video; once again becomes beligerent and the Court has ordered the microphone be muted so the Court is not disrupted by the deft but the defendant can hear the proceedings. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends 4 yrs WPS on each of the BJ counts bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES consec and 90 days RCJ on Ct 1 - the DC.

BTC: The defendant was given his right to speak to the Court regarding his sentencing and has chosen not to.

         Ct 1 - 90 days RCJ
         Cts 2: Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, conc with Ct 1/CFTS (709 days)
         Cts 3: Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec to Ct 2
         Ct 4 - Total sentnece is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, consec to Ct 3 if revoked/STAYED. 3 yrs prob

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs-payable during ES and probation
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's 
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically anger management and cognitive intervention
no taverns, bars and liquor stores

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP

from DOC

atty Johnson

Charges as in the attached information.

DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING

Charges as in the attached information.

BOND IS REVOKED PENDING SENTENCING

Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defendant is in custody at RCJ but refuses to come down to Court until he was able to speak with his atty. Defense met with deft and indicates that he will not come down and is ok with waiving his appearance at this hearing. The Court suggested, as an alternative to the deft being present, that deft may appear by video conference. The defendant continues to refuse.

BTC: Deft's appearance is waived due to the actions of the defendant by refusing to come to Court. Defense motion is granted and deft will be re-sentenced. Motion as to unfair trial is denied.
           Mr. Nolan Jensen is allowed to withdraw as he is the appellate counsel and Atty, Heather Johnson will be appointed to represent the defendant.
           Mr. Nolan Jensen is to draft the order vacating the sentence and to draft the order for the denial of deft's motion.
           Upon the Court signing the order to vacate the sentence, the deft will be held w/o bond in RCJ
                         Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Preliminary hearing on February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
